name: antlr

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
ANTLR (ANother Tool for Language Recognition) is a powerful parser
generator for reading, processing, executing, or translating structured
text or binary files. It's widely used to build languages, tools, and
frameworks. From a grammar, ANTLR generates a parser that can build and
walk parse trees.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: java
dependencies.description:
The Java Development Kit (JDK) released by Oracle Corporation in the
form of a binary product aimed at Java developers. Includes a complete
JRE plus tools for developing, debugging, and monitoring Java
applications.

dependent_to.name: nco
dependent_to.description:
The NCO toolkit manipulates and analyzes data stored in netCDF-
accessible formats

dependent_to.name: srcml
dependent_to.description:
srcML is an XML format for source code. The XML markup identifies
elements of the abstract syntax of the source-code language. The toolkit
includes parsing supports conversion of C, C++, C#, and Java both to and
from the srcML format. The format allows leveraging XML tools to support
the various tasks of source code exploration, analysis, and
manipulation.
